page.title: 08Village Primary School
page.content: Hope_under_Dinmore can still boast its own village school.The{school}was {built}in the{1860's.}There was a four bedroomed school house.One room down_ stairs was the{first classroom.}The school was enlarged to give two proper sized classrooms.Coal fires gave heat to the school in winter.A coal fired boiler in a little cellar heated hot water pipes running round the school. Depending on the number of pupils,the school has always had a head teacher plus one or two assistant teachers. This means that the school never was a large one.The{village}is also{small}& {has never been able to supply large {numbers of children.}A few years ago the old school house was demolished & a modern classroom built in its place. Only 2 of the 3 classrooms are now in use because,sadly,{the 2 teachers now {here,only have 26 children to teach.
